summary: "The Blair Witch Project" is a 1999 horror movie about three student filmmakers who go missing while making a documentary about a local legend in Maryland. The movie is presented as the "found footage" from their cameras. Most of it was filmed in Maryland, with actors Heather Donahue, Michael C. Williams, and Joshua Leonard improvising their dialogue. The low-budget film became a huge success, grossing over $250 million and inspiring a franchise including sequels, books, and games. It also made the "found footage" style popular in horror movies.
title: The Blair Witch Project
